channel.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
channel.description:
Don't keep all of those models you make to yourself.. I did that about a year ago and I have no access to any of those models now. So seriously. Just release it, if your that good, and you want that much rep. Just release it. There is no point in being a selfish meany x]
But seriously.
Just let it go.

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Mr. Linksys:

Lol. I mean like special holding styles or an attack

If you need help, i can help you with it. I’m trying to learn right now.

Read full topic
item.source: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“hitman2009, post:22, topic:332387”]I agree.
In my own opinion:
Yeah, the good modelers keep the models to themselves and I guess I sort of understand that. They want them to be the only people with the model, they want to show it off and show off their good work. But I don’t fully understand why keeping acheives this. Most of the time, someone either decompiles and rips a model from their client or someone else achieves the same or near the same model. I’ve seen loads of cases where people wouldn’t share their models, so somebody else stole them and released to the public. Then, the original owner of the models moans and bitches saying they want credit for their work. IMO, if they want credit, they’d released it themselves. (This goes for most other advancements as well, not just models).[/quote]

Thats precisely why if i release something, it went in my own client, or a friends client. Never put something in your client (even if you have a models.idx like Palidino did) because i can even rip those apart

Read full topic
item.source: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @hitman2009 hitman2009
item.description:
@hitman2009 wrote:

I agree.
In my own opinion:
Yeah, the good modelers keep the models to themselves and I guess I sort of understand that. They want them to be the only people with the model, they want to show it off and show off their good work. But I don’t fully understand why keeping acheives this. Most of the time, someone either decompiles and rips a model from their client or someone else achieves the same or near the same model. I’ve seen loads of cases where people wouldn’t share their models, so somebody else stole them and released to the public. Then, the original owner of the models moans and bitches saying they want credit for their work. IMO, if they want credit, they’d released it themselves. (This goes for most other advancements as well, not just models).

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:14, topic:332387”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=428822.msg3148838#msg3148838 date=1268348506]

Lol. krackkid are you good with animating?

Lol, animation is not my thing(its fun), but I am not “good” at it, I mite make some more models for everyone to cry about.

I might be able to help with that, depending on what kind of animation you’r talking about.
[/quote]
No, your racist >.> [size=1pt](jk ofc)[/size]and also I dont really wanna learn.[/quote]

Didn’t mean help you. Fuck dude, i could teach a 9 year-old dog to roll-over before i could teach you something. Ur like, a brick in the wall. Ur there, holding it up, somehow. Remove it, and you just have a hole, so we leave you here to make it look pretty

@Mr. Linksys - Weapon, boot, gloves, helmet, shield, and i dont think any other kinds of animating are actually included into the DatMaker, just platebodies, some helmets, and platelegs/skirts do need to be manually animated.

Read full topic

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Linksys Mr. Linksys
item.description:
@Mr_Linksys wrote:

Lol it wasn’t necessarily directed towards anybody. But I lost ALL of my best work. And I’m just saying, once it’s on the internet, it’s always there. You could lose a thumbdrive, or your computer could crash.

All I am saying is better safe than sorry.
Kind of like sex x]

Read full topic
item.source: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers

item.title: A Word Of Advice To Good Modelers
item.dc:creator: @Guardianman5 Guardianman5
item.description:
@Guardianman5 wrote:

I have a thumb drive that whenever I finish a model, I put it on there, it’s all models. So you could do that for saftey to. Just saying. But yeah good point because before my thumb drive idea My computer crashed and I lost all of my work… And It pretty much BLOWS. So back them up or post them here or somthing, you will regret it if you don’t.

Read full topic
